definition: to drop/to fall/to come down/to descend
square/frame/rule/(legal) case/style/character/standard/pattern/(grammar) case/(classical) to obstruct/to hinder/(classical) to arrive/to come/(classical) to investigate/to study exhaustively

sentences.english: She find it a comedown to listen to her former subordinate.
sentences.chinese: 她觉得要听她以前部下的指挥很降格。

sentences.english: The threat of employment persuades workers to moderate their pay demands.
sentences.chinese: 失业的威胁驱使工人们只好对工资降格以求。

sentences.english: Mandatory racial separatism demeans human beings and forecloses on their life prospects.
sentences.chinese: 强制的种族隔离把人降格，消灭了他们对生活的期望。

sentences.english: The time has come to turn away from the condescending policies of paternalism.
sentences.chinese: 如今已到了扬弃那种家长制的降格相求政策的时刻。

definition: to send away to serve a penal sentence
going from there to lower grades (idiom)
compiled and published by Imperial command (old)
to wait to fill a vacancy/reserve (candidate)/alternate/substitute
